title: Positive definite kernels: past, present and future
abstract: Positive definite kernels play an increasingly prominent role in many applications such as scattered data fitting, numerical solution of PDEs, computer experiments, machine learning, rapid prototyping and computer graphics. We discuss some of the historical and current developments of the theory and applications of positive definite kernels – always with an eye toward the mathematics of Gottingen in general and Robert Schaback in particular. A few comments concerning the future of the field are also provided.

tldr.text: Some of the historical and current developments of the theory and applications of positive definite kernels are discussed – always with an eye toward the mathematics of Gottingen in general and Robert Schaback in particular.
